metadata.title: CVE-2024-26977 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:pci_iounmap(): Fix MMIO mapping leak The #ifdef ARCH_HAS_GENERIC_IOPORT_MAPaccidentally also guards iounmap(), which means MMIO mappings are leaked.Move the guard so we call iounmap() for MMIO mappings.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26977` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
